title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Garcia Ridge Red (San Luis Obispo)
description: Black plum, black grape, fresh purple flowers, lavender and Dr. Pepper aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Zinfandel, 40% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. Those somewhat primary flavors also show on the fruit-punch-like sip, with is candid and joyous but nearly cloying with sweetness. Sharp acidity rises on the finish.

title: Waterbrook 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of black currant, garden herbs, green pepper and black plum show a lot of purity. The flavors are plump and pleasant, with the concentration seeming to dip in the middle.

title: Waterbrook 2016 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Fruit forward aromas of raspberry jam, baking spice and oak lead to lightly styled red fruit flavors. This lacks in concentration but what's there is an enjoyable, straightforward expression.

title: Boston Winery 2015 The Black Dog Great White (California)
description: This wine is nice and dry, tipping toward acidity in terms of balance and tastes fresh and citrusy. Its flavors are pretty subtle but it has a good quenching factor and no distractions.

title: Davino 2013 Domaine Ceptura Rouge Red (Dealu Mare)
description: A blend of 55% Feteasca Neagra, 30% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, this garnet colored wine displays aromas of black plum, vanilla and a slight touch of peppermint. On the palate there are flavors of dark plums and blackberry.

title: Decibel 2016 Crownthorpe Vineyard Rosé (Hawke's Bay)
description: Sunset-hued, this is a simple, fruity sipper complete with slightly confected notes of cherry and watermelon, with strawberry leaf and some dried green herbs. Light to medium in body, the palate is slippery in texture and packed with more ripe fruits. This could handle a wide variety of summer dishes.

title: Cascina Adelaide 2013 4 Vigne  (Barolo)
description: This hearty no-frills red has earthy aromas of underbrush, used leather, tobacco leaf and subdued berry. The brawny, monolithic palate shows cranberry jam, vanilla and orange peel alongside solid tannins and the warmth of alcohol. It lacks the complexity one expects in Barolo.

title: Château de Potiron 2014 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This wine is heavily oaked, which smothers the fruit and leaves a palate with flavors of smoke and bitter coffee. Hints of fruitiness give it a little bit of lift.

title: Château Grand Jean 2016  Bordeaux
description: Smooth and rounded, this wine picks up on the ripe fruit of the vintage and adds plenty of acidity and light spice. It is an immediately attractive wine, with fruitiness that makes it ready to drink.

title: Allen Estate Wines 2013 Audacieux Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Waxy cranberry and currant combine on the nose and entry of this wine, which shows a bitter twist of tannin midway through. Graphite, dried herb and a strong streak of cedar characterize the taste profile, with full-bodied ripeness packing a punch.

title: Avaler 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This moderately priced wine offers restrained acidity, opting instead for soft approachable flavors of baked plum and black cherry. The oak is pronounced.

title: Château Sainte-Catherine 2015 Château de Foucaud  (Bordeaux)
description: This wine offers flavors of black currants and fresh berries, with a slightly stalky undertone. It has the juicy, jammy fruit of the vintage as well as plenty of acidity. Spice and vanilla come through to balance the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Campo Viejo 2016  Rioja
description: Dry, spicy plum and cherry aromas are typical of good basic Rioja. This is medium in body, with somewhat rough tannins and spanking acidity. Plum and berry flavors are common, and it's racy on the finish.

title: Cave Robert & Marcel 2015 Les Petites Roches Puy Notre Dame  (Saumur)
description: Puy Notre Dame is one of the named villages of the Saumur region. This cool red, stalky and crisp, has a smoky character, ripe red-berry fruits and mineral tannins. It will soften a little more and should be ready to drink from late 2018.
designation: Les Petites Roches Puy Notre Dame

title: Cave Spring 2016 Pinot Noir (Niagara Escarpment)
description: This young wine feels hard and thin. Flavors of herbs and not quite ripe berries finish with an odd touch of butter.

title: Gibbs 2014 Three Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine includes small percentages (5% each) of Merlot, Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot. Altogether the experience is confectionery in marshmallow, mocha and blueberry, with a perception of sweetness amid its soft pillowy tannins.

title: Grove Mill 2014 Pinot Noir (Wairau Valley)
description: This is a plush, oaky wine, with ripe cherry, strawberry, floral and sweetbread characters that are a little overwhelmed by soap oak tones. The sweet red fruit continues on the palate followed by a bitter oak finish.

title: Latah Creek 2015 Fries Vineyard Carmenère (Wahluke Slope)
description: Listed at an alcohol level almost unheard of in modern days for a red wine in Washington, the aromas pop in notes of vanilla and other wood spice, with poblano and white pepper. The cranberry and barrel flavors tussle a bit on the palate, not seeming in harmony.

title: Latah Creek 2016 Familigia Vineyard Chardonnay (Ancient Lakes)
description: Light but pleasant aromas of baked apple and spice are followed by dry and clean fruit flavors. There's not a lot of complexity but the variety is unmistakable.

title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2016 Estey  (Bordeaux)
description: A soft, smooth wine, light on tannins and rich in berry fruits, this immediately approachable. With its generous texture and final acidity, it is ready to drink now.

title: Little Beauty 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: The nose starts out promising, if austere, with notes of grapefruit, waxy lemon, melon rind, grass and celery stalk, all wrapped in a flinty, matchstick blanket. The palate brings searing acidity, with some odd residual sugar and just barely enough citrus and tropical fruit weight to keep it afloat.

title: Marco Bonfante 2011 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)
description: This has subdued aromas reminiscent of dark berry, cooking spice and scorched earth. The simple palate offers sour cherry, powdered sage and clove alongside raspy tannins that give it an abrupt, astringent finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty aromas of vanilla and cotton candy include hints of sweat and funk. This vintage brut rosé feels narrow and citric, but fair and fresh. Bitter orange and grapefruit flavors finish dry and a touch flat.
designation: MM Reserva de la Familia Brut Rosé

title: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Charred cedar is strong on the nose of this bottling along with sweet black cherry aromas. The palate is also very woody, with damp forest and pine oil flavors overcoming the tangy red fruit.

title: Maryhill 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light in color, aromas of plum, herb, barrel spice and crushed peanut lead to tart raspberry and plum flavors that come up a bit short on the finish. It's a straightforward, enjoyable offering.

title: Nick Goldschmidt 2017 Boulder Bank Fitzroy Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a simple yet slippery-textured wine, with an attractive, perfumed nose of lime blossom, tropical and stone fruit. The fruit weight on the palate hints at a feeling of sweetness, but there's just enough acidity to keep things in balance.

title: Pierre Tailleur de Vins 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)
description: This is light in character, with soft aromas and flavors of strawberry-rhubarb pie dusted in cocoa powder. It's smooth and easy in feel, with a light palate and straightforward but attractive fruit flavors that finish clean and juicy. Drink now.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne

title: Ramon Roqueta 2016 Garnacha (Catalunya)
description: A transparent red color and aromas of cherry and plum set up a wiry, clipped palate with juicy acidity. Spunky plum flavors turn more roasted on a finish with barbecued notes.

title: Roth 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a robust oak-driven white, rich in baked and concentrated apple, melon and pineapple flavors. The structure is moderate if not somewhat muddled, with a nuttiness that comes through on the finish.

title: Sawtooth 2015 Classic Fly Series Malbec
description: The aromas bring unusual, not entirely harmonious notes of white pepper, citrus twist, green herb and spice. The flavors are quite light and elegant, with an attenuated finish. It doesn't have the stuffing to stand it up.
